result.execSummary:
The defendant Felina Marie LaPointe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Felina Marie LaPointe in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman.  Defendant Felina Marie LaPointe in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15 CF 36 and 13 CM 421.  8:47 AM  Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Court addressed Attorney Waterman as to ex parte communitcation - State acknowledged receipt of letter.  State argues sentencing - 7 months county jail - 82 days credit time served - any unpaid financial obligations converted to civil judgment.  Atty Waterman makes arguement as to sentencing requests 118 days credit.  Court questions attorney's as to days credit.  Parties agree to 89 days.  Atty Waterman continues requests time served.  DE addressed the Court.

Court:  15 CF 36:  4 months county jail credit for 89 days time served  - unpaid court obligations are converted to civil judgment
